details.publicNotes:
When you wish upon a star, it doesn't matter who you are, anything your heart desires will drive a golem to come to you. As there are stars countlessly dotting the night's sky, all of them are unfathomable millennia old, some of them became magically charged with Wish for reasons that only the divines could understand.

All that is known from Everglow's perspective is that a hunk of meteorite breaks through the atmosphere before immediately searching for the person who inadvertently wished them into existence, willing to break anything or anyone in its task, believing the person is genuinely miserable and wants the golem to replace them, much to the chagrin of many city dwellers with a high concentration of very breakable things and people. In the event the person is scattered to stardust, a new star is formed among the skies and the golem attempts to resolve the duties of the individual it replaced.

Unfortunately, as a construct made of meteorite is hard to mistake for most of Everglow's residents, it doesn't take long before they are chased into hiding from a grieving village, or forced to use deadly force if it is sought out by people it believes wish to inflict harm upon it.

description.value: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} against the Star Golem acts as the spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}, overriding the Wish that brought it into it's original existence.

Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} successfully against the Star Golem's Will DC will leave the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 10 minutes, as the magic is termporarily ridden from the Star Golem's body.

The Star Golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 37 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golems fist.

If the wisher is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, knocked out or dead, The Star Golem begins to turn to turn their body to stardust and preserves their soul on the material plane. The creature's soul is protected from necromancy magic that destroys the soul and sets the time limit for necromancy magic that doesn't destroy the soul to be indefinite, possibly trapping the soul on the mortal plane long enough to be displaced from their companions. Once the Star Golem succeeds at this, it will no longer hunt this player
The stargolem has a breath weapon that deals @Damage[18d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], the Star Golem can use this again in [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}
The Star-Golem knows the direction of the creature who wished them into existence, but not their distance.
